item.title: China floods: 12 dead in Zhengzhou train and thousands evacuated in Henan
item.description: Passengers describe how they climbed onto chairs to keep their heads above the floodwaters.

item.title: Pegasus: Princess Latifa and Princess Haya numbers 'among leaks'
item.description: Numbers used by Princesses Latifa and Haya are reportedly found in a database at the heart of the leaks.

item.title: Former informant 'White Boy Rick' sues FBI for $100m
item.description: The one-time teenage FBI informant says his work with the agency amounts to 'child abuse'

item.title: Monkeypox: More than 200 contacts tracked in US for rare disease
item.description: No instances of the rare disease had been recorded in the US since 2003.

item.title: British man arrested in Spain over Twitter hack
item.description: The 2020 attack on a series of celebrity accounts targeted Elon Musk and Barack Obama, among others.

item.title: Gender reveal party couple face jail over deadly California wildfire
item.description: A California couple are charged over an event last year blamed for sparking a deadly blaze.

item.title: Wildfires: Firefighters battle blaze from top of moving train
item.description: Officials in California are pulling out all the stops to contain the state's largest wildfire.

item.title: Covid: Anger as half of Australians in lockdown again
item.description: Three states enforce stay-at-home orders, fuelling criticism of Australia's slow vaccination rate.

item.title: Mucormycosis: India records more than 4,300 'black fungus' deaths
item.description: The normally rare infection has a 50% mortality rate and is hitting recovering Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Gold toilet found in Russian police bribery probe
item.description: Investigators show video of a palatial villa, accusing traffic police of a mafia-style racket.

item.title: Thomas Barrack: Top Trump aide accused of working as foreign agent
item.description: Thomas Barrack is alleged to have lobbied the US government on behalf of the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: Covid: France rolls out health pass as cases soar
item.description: From Wednesday people will need proof of vaccination or a negative test to access some public places.

item.title: Sudan's Darfur conflict's latest surge in violence displaces thousands
item.description: "I have cried so much, my eyes can barely see," one mother tells the BBC after seeing her brother die.

item.title: Pegasus scandal: Are we all becoming unknowing spies?
item.description: We may be stepping into a world in which we are all spies - and at the same time are all spied on.

item.title: Covid: The Mexican villages refusing to vaccinate
item.description: Residents in remote Mexican towns are being influenced by lies and rumours swirling around on WhatsApp.

item.title: Wally Funk: The 82-year-old on Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin flight
item.description: Wally Funk was overlooked for space flight in the 60s but got a second chance with Jeff Bezos.

item.title: Mandira Bedi: What Hindu scriptures say about women at cremations
item.description: Indian actress Mandira Bedi made news for doing her husband's last rites, generally a male preserve.

item.title: Germany grapples with flood havoc
item.description: A massive clean-up is under way, but Germany's flood damage won't be fixed for many months.

item.title: Zhengzhou Henan: Waist-high flooding hits China trains and roads
item.description: Roads and subway stations have been submerged and one region recorded 40cm (15 inches) of rainfall.

item.title: Henan floods: Woman swept down street by extreme flood waters
item.description: Bystanders managed to rescue the woman in Henan province, where several people have died amid flooding.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and crew launch into space on New Shepard
item.description: Billionaire Jeff Bezos has launched into space, in the first crewed flight of his rocket ship, New Shepard.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sweden stun USA in women's football opener
item.description: Sweden's women's football team stun world champions the United States in their opening match at the Olympic Games in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB women's football take the knee
item.description: Great Britain's women's football squad take the knee before their opening 2-0 win over Chile at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Where might hosts Japan win medals?
item.description: The Japanese Olympic Committee has set a target of 30 golds in Tokyo, but in which sports might those medals be won?

item.title: 2032 Games: Brisbane confirmed as Olympic and Paralympic host
item.description: Brisbane is confirmed as the host of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games after approval at an IOC meeting in Tokyo

item.title: From pretending to be a boy to going to the Games
item.description: Olympic boxing hopeful Caroline Dubois tells her incredible story of the journey to reach the pinnacle of her career.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.
